<!-- To import this information into a WordPress blog follow these steps. -->
<!-- 1. Log into that blog as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the blog's admin panels (or Manage: Import in older versions of WordPress). -->
<!-- 3. Choose "WordPress" from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 5. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the blog.  For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the blog or to create a new user -->
<!-- 6. WordPress will then import each of the posts, comments, and categories -->
<!--    contained in this file into your blog -->

		<item>
<title>Simplicity at it&#039;s Finest!</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/07/17/the-themeforest-top-25/</link>
<pubDate>Fri, 17 Jul 2009 07:02:33 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="sample-articles"><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=68</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The fonts you use for your website are an important decision, as they will often reflect your site’s tone and affect its visual impact. PixelCraft brings simple, beautiful font treatments to a Wordpress theme that's built to handle all types of content. Large fonts, small fonts - whatever you might need to send your message to users, PixelCraft has it! <!--more-->

<a href="http://blog.epicerastudio.com/?p=41"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-321" src="http://blog.epicerastudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/09/booklist.png" alt="" /></a>
6
When I was just getting started in design, I asked one of my <a href="http://alexkurth.com/">favorite designers </a>what single thing I could do to improve and expand my capabilities as a designer. His answer: "Read. Read everything you can get your hands on, empty your bank account, then read some more". Looking back on 7 years of designing, I'd have to say that was the single greatest bit of advice I ever received. So, without further ado, here's my list of recommendations.

<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0231"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0231/P0231_00.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Universal Principles of Design: 100 Ways to Enhance Usability, Influence Perception, Increase Appeal, Make Better Design Decisions, and Teach Through Design </a>by William Lidwell, Kritina Holden, and Jill Butler. Out of every book on my shelf, this is the one I find myself returning to time and again. This is an amazing little hardcover that breaks the entire world of design into 100 distinct, easy to follow concepts that will focus the way you think about anything that's been designed (and that could be everything, but I'm not here to debate religion). If you're to buy one book on this list, this is the one. Useful, practical, easy to read.
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Soak-Wash-Rinse-Tolleson-Design/dp/1568981988/ref=cm_lmf_img_10_rsrsrs0/104-1678091-0631930"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://g-ec2.images-amazon.com/images/I/21WQQ5W46HL._PIsitb-sm-arrow,TopRight,13,-17_OU01_.gif" alt="" /> Soak, Wash, Rinse, Spin</a> by Tolleson Design. This was one of my first design books, and still one of my favorites. Chalk full of useful information about the process behind successful design projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Screen-Essays-Graphic-Design-Culture/dp/1568983107/ref=pd_bbs_sr_2/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013743&amp;sr=8-2"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41EBTTVGGEL._SL500_BO2,204,203,200_PIsitb-dp-500-arrow,TopRight,45,-64_OU01_AA240_SH20_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Screen: Essays on Graphic Design, New Media, and Visual Culture </a> by Jessica Helfand and John Maeda. For anyone who's ever complained that there isn't enough relevant, contemporary, erudite writing about modern design dillemas, I submit exhibit A. As one reviewer on amazon put it: "Things we all were thinking... only worded much better". This tiny book packs a whallop of mind-bending analysis.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Noise-Four-Attik/dp/1584230940/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013979&amp;sr=8-1"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/21F869DFYSL._SL160_PIlitb-dp-arrow,TopRight,21,-23_SH30_OU01_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Noise Four </a>by Attik. Often called the "big white book" or "the design bible" (although I would disagree), this 5lb book is a visual feast of experimental design pieces. Great resource if you're seeking a quick entry into modern experimental graphic design or just some inspiration to break up the monotony of cut and paste projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Visual-Creativity-Mario-Pricken/dp/0500511667/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014272&amp;sr=1-1"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41NCZYB940L._SL500_AA240_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Visual Creativity </a>by Mario Pricken. Great analysis of the mental processes behind "visual imagination". This book systematically breaks down different types of visual imagination and provides lots of great excercises that one can practice to enhance their own capacity to blow people's minds. Oh, and it catagloues some of the greatest pieces of advertising in the last couple years on high quality glossy paper. Perfect coffee table fodder for the budding graphic artist.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Typography-27-Type-Directors-Club/dp/0061144231/ref=pd_bbs_sr_3/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014569&amp;sr=1-3"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41P76MXXQ7L._SL160_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Typography 27 </a>by the Type Directors Club. Really, any book from this series is worth its weight in gold. If you're going to follow one series of design annuals, this is it... phenomenal from every aspect.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0004"><img style="margin-right: 10px" src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0004/P0004_01.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Grid Systems in Graphic Design </a>by Josef Muller-Brockmann. THE definitive guide on grid systems in graphic design. A fantastic guide for solving just about any design problem with a grid. If you haven't cracked into grid systems yet, this is the book; if you've backslidden in your ways, now's the time to reaffirm your faith.
<br class="clear" />
I'll be adding lots more in the future... I pride myself on a library of great design books and magazines.  For any budding designer looking for a way to go beyond the standard textbooks, books are a great way to get started (and I would argue that these are perhaps a better, more robust form of education than the textbook variety).<a href="http://youworkforthem.com">YouWorkForThem.com</a> and <a href="http://amazon.com">Amazon</a> are great places to pick them up on the cheap too.</div>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

	</item>
<item>
<title>Upholding High Design Standards for Web Typography</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/09/03/upholding-high-design-standards-for-web-typography/</link>
<pubDate>Thu, 03 Sep 2009 16:36:19 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=95</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is an example of a WordPress page, you could edit this to put information about yourself or your site so readers know where you are coming from. You can create as many pages like this one or sub-pages as you like and manage all of your content inside of WordPress. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.  Nulla neque ipsum, rhoncus eu euismod sed, ullamcorper a urna. Aenean ut nibh odio, vitae mollis odio. Maecenas faucibus auctor interdum. Nam commodo vehicula sapien sit amet aliquam. Nam eu diam ac dolor volutpat consequat vitae at neque. Ut at tortor nisi. Aliquam sit amet sapien nibh. Vivamus quis tellus id eros volutpat condimentum sed ac ante. In vel tortor ac nibh sagittis pellentesque eu a est. Phasellus at libero massa, non mollis mauris.

<!--more-->
<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.</div>
<h2>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h2>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. <title>Pre-Designed Advertising and Promotional Spaces</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/09/26/testing-oh-yeah/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 26 Sep 2009 01:33:22 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="featured"><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/?p=5</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is an example of a WordPress page, you could edit this to put information about yourself or your site so readers know where you are coming from. You can create as many pages like this one or sub-pages as you like and manage all of your content inside of WordPress. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.  Nulla neque ipsum, rhoncus eu euismod sed, ullamcorper a urna. Aenean ut nibh odio, vitae mollis odio. Maecenas faucibus auctor interdum. Nam commodo vehicula sapien sit amet aliquam. Nam eu diam ac dolor volutpat consequat vitae at neque. Ut at tortor nisi. Aliquam sit amet sapien nibh. Vivamus quis tellus id eros volutpat condimentum sed ac ante. In vel tortor ac nibh sagittis pellentesque eu a est. Phasellus at libero massa, non mollis mauris.

<!--more-->
<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.</div>
<h2>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h2>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. </wp:postmeta>

<wp:meta_key>featured-full</wp:meta_key>
<wp:meta_value>http://makedesignnotwar.com/themes/pixelcraft/html/assets/img/newsbox/home-3.jpg</wp:meta_value>
</wp:postmeta>

<item>
<title>Contact</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/contact/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 28 Sep 2009 11:17:05 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[brandon]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/?page_id=17</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[PixelCraft comes complete with a full, working contact form manager. Build as many as you want and insert them into pages or posts with ease! Multiple custom fields, dropdowns, checkboxs, and so much more. Build the contact form that suits your exact needs, then put it to work on your site!

[contact-form 1 "Contact form 1"] ]]></content:encoded>

<title>PixelCraft is Customizable!</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/02/pixelcraft-is-customizable/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 03 Oct 2009 05:34:48 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="featured"><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="wordpress"><![CDATA[wordpress]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=22</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is an example of a WordPress page, you could edit this to put information about yourself or your site so readers know where you are coming from. You can create as many pages like this one or sub-pages as you like and manage all of your content inside of WordPress. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.  Nulla neque ipsum, rhoncus eu euismod sed, ullamcorper a urna. Aenean ut nibh odio, vitae mollis odio. Maecenas faucibus auctor interdum. Nam commodo vehicula sapien sit amet aliquam. Nam eu diam ac dolor volutpat consequat vitae at neque. Ut at tortor nisi. Aliquam sit amet sapien nibh. Vivamus quis tellus id eros volutpat condimentum sed ac ante. In vel tortor ac nibh sagittis pellentesque eu a est. Phasellus at libero massa, non mollis mauris.

<!--more-->
<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.</div>
<h2>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h2>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. It doesn't get much easier than this to add your own custom flare to a website template!]]></excerpt:encoded>

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. These are some more words to lengthen the line.]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>30</wp:post_id>

	</item>
<item>
<title>PixelCraft Loves Images!</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/09/pixelcraft-loves-images/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 10 Oct 2009 06:02:04 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="featured"><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="design"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[images]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="images"><![CDATA[images]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=32</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[Everyone knows the simplest way to draw instant attention from visitors is to dish out big, juicy images. Whether you want to use PixelCraft as a blog template, portfolio site, or a business website, you'll be equipped with everything you need to make your next site nothing short of beautiful. Heck, it even comes with a full-blown image gallery that can be used as a portfolio or a simple place to show off product thumbnails, photographs, or recent portfolio pieces.

<!--more-->

<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.</div>
<h2>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h2>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. These are some more words to lengthen the line.]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Everyone knows the simplest way to draw instant attention from visitors is to dish out big, juicy images. Whether you want to use PixelCraft as a blog template, portfolio site, or a business website, you'll be equipped with everything you need to make your next site nothing short of beautiful. Heck, it even comes with a full-blown image gallery that can be used as a portfolio or a simple place to show off product thumbnails, photographs, or recent portfolio pieces.]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>Packaged with a Fully Functional Contact Form!</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/09/packaged-with-a-fully-functional-contact-form/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 10 Oct 2009 06:02:50 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="featured"><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[contact form]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="contact-form"><![CDATA[contact form]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="design"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=34</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.</div>
<h2>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h2>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Vivamus nibh mi, commodo eu, pellentesque ut, blandit rutrum, ligula. Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus.

Praesent ultricies urna a urna. Quisque massa. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. These are some more words to lengthen the line.]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Using the awesome open source "Super Simple Contact Form", PixelCraft comes pre-packaged with a contact form that's as simple to use as pie. Just type in your email address, and you're ready to go. You can always enter, edit, or remove custom fields for the contact form as well. Just check out the Super Simple Contact Form website to replace the stock contact form with your own creation.]]></excerpt:encoded>

<item>
<title>PixelCraft: A New Premium Web Template</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/09/pixelcraft-a-new-premium-web-template/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 10 Oct 2009 06:08:35 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="featured"><![CDATA[Featured]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="design"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[jquery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="jquery"><![CDATA[jquery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=42</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[PixelCraft HTML has been specifically designed as a premium website template for businesses, photographers, designers, and bloggers. It includes 6 core page templates and 5 color variations, and the possibilities for customization are nearly limitless! This homepage allows you to showcase as many "feature" articles as you'd like, complete with images, title, and descriptions. What's more? You can link directly to a lightbox or any page on your site.

<!--more-->

The fonts you use for your website are an important decision, as they will often reflect your site’s tone and affect its visual impact.<!--more-->

<a href="http://blog.epicerastudio.com/?p=41"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-321" src="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/longimage5.jpg" alt="" /></a>

When I was just getting started in design, I asked one of my <a href="http://alexkurth.com/">favorite designers </a>what single thing I could do to improve and expand my capabilities as a designer. His answer: "Read. Read everything you can get your hands on, empty your bank account, then read some more". Looking back on 7 years of designing, I'd have to say that was the single greatest bit of advice I ever received. So, without further ado, here's my list of recommendations.

<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0231"><img src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0231/P0231_00.jpg" alt="" width="75" style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" /> Universal Principles of Design: 100 Ways to Enhance Usability, Influence Perception, Increase Appeal, Make Better Design Decisions, and Teach Through Design </a>by William Lidwell, Kritina Holden, and Jill Butler. Out of every book on my shelf, this is the one I find myself returning to time and again. This is an amazing little hardcover that breaks the entire world of design into 100 distinct, easy to follow concepts that will focus the way you think about anything that's been designed (and that could be everything, but I'm not here to debate religion). If you're to buy one book on this list, this is the one. Useful, practical, easy to read.
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Soak-Wash-Rinse-Tolleson-Design/dp/1568981988/ref=cm_lmf_img_10_rsrsrs0/104-1678091-0631930"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://g-ec2.images-amazon.com/images/I/21WQQ5W46HL._PIsitb-sm-arrow,TopRight,13,-17_OU01_.gif" alt="" /> Soak, Wash, Rinse, Spin</a> by Tolleson Design. This was one of my first design books, and still one of my favorites. Chalk full of useful information about the process behind successful design projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Screen-Essays-Graphic-Design-Culture/dp/1568983107/ref=pd_bbs_sr_2/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013743&amp;sr=8-2"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41EBTTVGGEL._SL500_BO2,204,203,200_PIsitb-dp-500-arrow,TopRight,45,-64_OU01_AA240_SH20_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Screen: Essays on Graphic Design, New Media, and Visual Culture </a> by Jessica Helfand and John Maeda. For anyone who's ever complained that there isn't enough relevant, contemporary, erudite writing about modern design dillemas, I submit exhibit A. As one reviewer on amazon put it: "Things we all were thinking... only worded much better". This tiny book packs a whallop of mind-bending analysis.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Noise-Four-Attik/dp/1584230940/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013979&amp;sr=8-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/21F869DFYSL._SL160_PIlitb-dp-arrow,TopRight,21,-23_SH30_OU01_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Noise Four </a>by Attik. Often called the "big white book" or "the design bible" (although I would disagree), this 5lb book is a visual feast of experimental design pieces. Great resource if you're seeking a quick entry into modern experimental graphic design or just some inspiration to break up the monotony of cut and paste projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Visual-Creativity-Mario-Pricken/dp/0500511667/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014272&amp;sr=1-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41NCZYB940L._SL500_AA240_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Visual Creativity </a>by Mario Pricken. Great analysis of the mental processes behind "visual imagination". This book systematically breaks down different types of visual imagination and provides lots of great excercises that one can practice to enhance their own capacity to blow people's minds. Oh, and it catagloues some of the greatest pieces of advertising in the last couple years on high quality glossy paper. Perfect coffee table fodder for the budding graphic artist.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Typography-27-Type-Directors-Club/dp/0061144231/ref=pd_bbs_sr_3/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014569&amp;sr=1-3"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41P76MXXQ7L._SL160_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Typography 27 </a>by the Type Directors Club. Really, any book from this series is worth its weight in gold. If you're going to follow one series of design annuals, this is it... phenomenal from every aspect.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px">
<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0004"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0004/P0004_01.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Grid Systems in Graphic Design </a>by Josef Muller-Brockmann. THE definitive guide on grid systems in graphic design. A fantastic guide for solving just about any design problem with a grid. If you haven't cracked into grid systems yet, this is the book; if you've backslidden in your ways, now's the time to reaffirm your faith.
<br class="clear" />
I'll be adding lots more in the future... I pride myself on a library of great design books and magazines.  For any budding designer looking for a way to go beyond the standard textbooks, books are a great way to get started (and I would argue that these are perhaps a better, more robust form of education than the textbook variety).<a href="http://youworkforthem.com">YouWorkForThem.com</a> and <a href="http://amazon.com">Amazon</a> are great places to pick them up on the cheap too.<p></p></div>p on the cheap too.<p></p>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[PixelCraft HTML has been specifically designed as a premium website template for businesses, photographers, designers, and bloggers. It includes 6 core page templates and 5 color variations, and the possibilities for customization are nearly limitless! This homepage allows you to showcase as many "feature" articles as you'd like, complete with images, title, and descriptions. What's more? You can link directly to a lightbox or any page on your site.]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
<item>
<title> jQuery: A Round Up of the Best Tutorials Around</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/09/jquery-a-round-up-of-the-best-tutorials-around/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 10 Oct 2009 06:12:06 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="sample-articles"><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[clean]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="clean"><![CDATA[clean]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="design"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[illustration]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="illustration"><![CDATA[illustration]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[jquery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="jquery"><![CDATA[jquery]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[lettering]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="lettering"><![CDATA[lettering]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[modern]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="modern"><![CDATA[modern]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[premium]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="premium"><![CDATA[premium]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[theme]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="theme"><![CDATA[theme]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[web]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[wordpress]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="wordpress"><![CDATA[wordpress]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=45</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The fonts you use for your website are an important decision, as they will often reflect your site’s tone and affect its visual impact.<!--more-->

<a href="http://blog.epicerastudio.com/?p=41"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-321" src="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/longimage5.jpg" alt="" /></a>

When I was just getting started in design, I asked one of my <a href="http://alexkurth.com/">favorite designers </a>what single thing I could do to improve and expand my capabilities as a designer. His answer: "Read. Read everything you can get your hands on, empty your bank account, then read some more". Looking back on 7 years of designing, I'd have to say that was the single greatest bit of advice I ever received. So, without further ado, here's my list of recommendations.

<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0231"><img src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0231/P0231_00.jpg" alt="" width="75" style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" /> Universal Principles of Design: 100 Ways to Enhance Usability, Influence Perception, Increase Appeal, Make Better Design Decisions, and Teach Through Design </a>by William Lidwell, Kritina Holden, and Jill Butler. Out of every book on my shelf, this is the one I find myself returning to time and again. This is an amazing little hardcover that breaks the entire world of design into 100 distinct, easy to follow concepts that will focus the way you think about anything that's been designed (and that could be everything, but I'm not here to debate religion). If you're to buy one book on this list, this is the one. Useful, practical, easy to read.
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Soak-Wash-Rinse-Tolleson-Design/dp/1568981988/ref=cm_lmf_img_10_rsrsrs0/104-1678091-0631930"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://g-ec2.images-amazon.com/images/I/21WQQ5W46HL._PIsitb-sm-arrow,TopRight,13,-17_OU01_.gif" alt="" /> Soak, Wash, Rinse, Spin</a> by Tolleson Design. This was one of my first design books, and still one of my favorites. Chalk full of useful information about the process behind successful design projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Screen-Essays-Graphic-Design-Culture/dp/1568983107/ref=pd_bbs_sr_2/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013743&amp;sr=8-2"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41EBTTVGGEL._SL500_BO2,204,203,200_PIsitb-dp-500-arrow,TopRight,45,-64_OU01_AA240_SH20_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Screen: Essays on Graphic Design, New Media, and Visual Culture </a> by Jessica Helfand and John Maeda. For anyone who's ever complained that there isn't enough relevant, contemporary, erudite writing about modern design dillemas, I submit exhibit A. As one reviewer on amazon put it: "Things we all were thinking... only worded much better". This tiny book packs a whallop of mind-bending analysis.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Noise-Four-Attik/dp/1584230940/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013979&amp;sr=8-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/21F869DFYSL._SL160_PIlitb-dp-arrow,TopRight,21,-23_SH30_OU01_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Noise Four </a>by Attik. Often called the "big white book" or "the design bible" (although I would disagree), this 5lb book is a visual feast of experimental design pieces. Great resource if you're seeking a quick entry into modern experimental graphic design or just some inspiration to break up the monotony of cut and paste projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Visual-Creativity-Mario-Pricken/dp/0500511667/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014272&amp;sr=1-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41NCZYB940L._SL500_AA240_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Visual Creativity </a>by Mario Pricken. Great analysis of the mental processes behind "visual imagination". This book systematically breaks down different types of visual imagination and provides lots of great excercises that one can practice to enhance their own capacity to blow people's minds. Oh, and it catagloues some of the greatest pieces of advertising in the last couple years on high quality glossy paper. Perfect coffee table fodder for the budding graphic artist.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Typography-27-Type-Directors-Club/dp/0061144231/ref=pd_bbs_sr_3/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014569&amp;sr=1-3"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41P76MXXQ7L._SL160_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Typography 27 </a>by the Type Directors Club. Really, any book from this series is worth its weight in gold. If you're going to follow one series of design annuals, this is it... phenomenal from every aspect.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px">
<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0004"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0004/P0004_01.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Grid Systems in Graphic Design </a>by Josef Muller-Brockmann. THE definitive guide on grid systems in graphic design. A fantastic guide for solving just about any design problem with a grid. If you haven't cracked into grid systems yet, this is the book; if you've backslidden in your ways, now's the time to reaffirm your faith.
<br class="clear" />
I'll be adding lots more in the future... I pride myself on a library of great design books and magazines.  For any budding designer looking for a way to go beyond the standard textbooks, books are a great way to get started (and I would argue that these are perhaps a better, more robust form of education than the textbook variety).<a href="http://youworkforthem.com">YouWorkForThem.com</a> and <a href="http://amazon.com">Amazon</a> are great places to pick them up on the cheap too.<p></p></div>]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>45</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2009-10-09 23:12:06</wp:post_date>

<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
<wp:post_name>jquery-a-round-up-of-the-best-tutorials-around</wp:post_name>
<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>

</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
<item>
<title>Coda: An In Depth Look at 25 New Features</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/09/coda-an-in-depth-look-at-25-new-features/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 10 Oct 2009 06:12:54 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="sample-articles"><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="modern"><![CDATA[modern]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[notepad]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="notepad"><![CDATA[notepad]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="typography"><![CDATA[typography]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[web]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="web"><![CDATA[web]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?p=47</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[The fonts you use for your website are an important decision, as they will often reflect your site’s tone and affect its visual impact.<!--more-->

<a href="http://blog.epicerastudio.com/?p=41"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-321" src="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/longimage5.jpg" alt="" /></a>

When I was just getting started in design, I asked one of my <a href="http://alexkurth.com/">favorite designers </a>what single thing I could do to improve and expand my capabilities as a designer. His answer: "Read. Read everything you can get your hands on, empty your bank account, then read some more". Looking back on 7 years of designing, I'd have to say that was the single greatest bit of advice I ever received. So, without further ado, here's my list of recommendations.

<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0231"><img src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0231/P0231_00.jpg" alt="" width="75" style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" /> Universal Principles of Design: 100 Ways to Enhance Usability, Influence Perception, Increase Appeal, Make Better Design Decisions, and Teach Through Design </a>by William Lidwell, Kritina Holden, and Jill Butler. Out of every book on my shelf, this is the one I find myself returning to time and again. This is an amazing little hardcover that breaks the entire world of design into 100 distinct, easy to follow concepts that will focus the way you think about anything that's been designed (and that could be everything, but I'm not here to debate religion). If you're to buy one book on this list, this is the one. Useful, practical, easy to read.
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Soak-Wash-Rinse-Tolleson-Design/dp/1568981988/ref=cm_lmf_img_10_rsrsrs0/104-1678091-0631930"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://g-ec2.images-amazon.com/images/I/21WQQ5W46HL._PIsitb-sm-arrow,TopRight,13,-17_OU01_.gif" alt="" /> Soak, Wash, Rinse, Spin</a> by Tolleson Design. This was one of my first design books, and still one of my favorites. Chalk full of useful information about the process behind successful design projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Screen-Essays-Graphic-Design-Culture/dp/1568983107/ref=pd_bbs_sr_2/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013743&amp;sr=8-2"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41EBTTVGGEL._SL500_BO2,204,203,200_PIsitb-dp-500-arrow,TopRight,45,-64_OU01_AA240_SH20_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Screen: Essays on Graphic Design, New Media, and Visual Culture </a> by Jessica Helfand and John Maeda. For anyone who's ever complained that there isn't enough relevant, contemporary, erudite writing about modern design dillemas, I submit exhibit A. As one reviewer on amazon put it: "Things we all were thinking... only worded much better". This tiny book packs a whallop of mind-bending analysis.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Noise-Four-Attik/dp/1584230940/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186013979&amp;sr=8-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/21F869DFYSL._SL160_PIlitb-dp-arrow,TopRight,21,-23_SH30_OU01_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Noise Four </a>by Attik. Often called the "big white book" or "the design bible" (although I would disagree), this 5lb book is a visual feast of experimental design pieces. Great resource if you're seeking a quick entry into modern experimental graphic design or just some inspiration to break up the monotony of cut and paste projects.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Visual-Creativity-Mario-Pricken/dp/0500511667/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014272&amp;sr=1-1"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41NCZYB940L._SL500_AA240_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Visual Creativity </a>by Mario Pricken. Great analysis of the mental processes behind "visual imagination". This book systematically breaks down different types of visual imagination and provides lots of great excercises that one can practice to enhance their own capacity to blow people's minds. Oh, and it catagloues some of the greatest pieces of advertising in the last couple years on high quality glossy paper. Perfect coffee table fodder for the budding graphic artist.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Typography-27-Type-Directors-Club/dp/0061144231/ref=pd_bbs_sr_3/104-1678091-0631930?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1186014569&amp;sr=1-3"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41P76MXXQ7L._SL160_AA115_.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Typography 27 </a>by the Type Directors Club. Really, any book from this series is worth its weight in gold. If you're going to follow one series of design annuals, this is it... phenomenal from every aspect.</div>
<div style="clear: both;margin-top: 15px">
<a href="http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=P0004"><img style="margin: 5px 10px 10px 0pt; float: left;" src="http://www.youworkforthem.com/images/print/P0004/P0004_01.jpg" alt="" width="75" /> Grid Systems in Graphic Design </a>by Josef Muller-Brockmann. THE definitive guide on grid systems in graphic design. A fantastic guide for solving just about any design problem with a grid. If you haven't cracked into grid systems yet, this is the book; if you've backslidden in your ways, now's the time to reaffirm your faith.
<br class="clear" />
I'll be adding lots more in the future... I pride myself on a library of great design books and magazines.  For any budding designer looking for a way to go beyond the standard textbooks, books are a great way to get started (and I would argue that these are perhaps a better, more robust form of education than the textbook variety).<a href="http://youworkforthem.com">YouWorkForThem.com</a> and <a href="http://amazon.com">Amazon</a> are great places to pick them up on the cheap too.<p></p></div>]]></content:encoded>

<title>Image Bar</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/image-bar/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 12 Oct 2009 18:26:09 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=49</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ul class="pic_list">
			<li><a href="http://atlantica.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/07/fullsize.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/pic_list/sample01.jpg" alt="Sample" /></a></li>
			<li><a href="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/newsbox/home-1.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/pic_list/sample02.jpg" alt="Sample" /></a></li>
			<li><a href="http://atlantica.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/07/fullsize.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/pic_list/sample03.jpg" alt="Sample" /></a></li>
			<li><a href="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/newsbox/home-1.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/pic_list/sample04.jpg" alt="Sample" /></a></li>
			<li class="last"><a href="http://atlantica.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/07/fullsize.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://pixel.wpc-dev.com/wp-content/themes/pixel/assets/img/pic_list/sample05.jpg" alt="Sample" /></a></li>
		</ul>]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Great Use of Typography in Modern Web Design</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/2009/10/12/great-use-of-typography-in-modern-web-design/</link>
<pubDate>Mon, 12 Oct 2009 18:42:40 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="sample-articles"><![CDATA[Sample Articles]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[clean]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="clean"><![CDATA[clean]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="design"><![CDATA[design]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[illustration]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="illustration"><![CDATA[illustration]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[lettering]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="lettering"><![CDATA[lettering]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[modern]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="modern"><![CDATA[modern]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[premium]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="premium"><![CDATA[premium]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[theme]]></category>

Nam eu diam ac dolor volutpat consequat vitae at neque. Ut at tortor nisi. Aliquam sit amet sapien nibh. Vivamus quis tellus id eros volutpat condimentum sed ac ante. In vel tortor ac nibh sagittis pellentesque eu a est. Phasellus at libero massa, non mollis mauris.

<h2>This is a Subheadline</h2>

Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. Curabitur euismod sollicitudin elit. Donec faucibus lacus nec sapien. Aliquam ipsum nisi, scelerisque et, commodo nec, consectetur vel, tellus. Cras ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui.
<ul>
	<li>Sed congue, dui vel tristique mollis, libero elit convallis eros, vitae interdum libero dolor eget leo.</li>
	<li>Morbi eget sem. Nam mollis. Donec sed velit ut tellus fermentum interdum.</li>
	<li>Etiam a odio in neque egestas consequat. Pellentesque posuere, orci id interdum.</li>
	<li>Suspendisse id magna in libero porta faucibus. Vivamus sollicitudin.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Here’s Another One</h2>
Mauris vulputate metus eu nisl. Praesent placerat. Mauris vitae erat id ante viverra sodales.  Proin tincidunt porta velit. Sed a ligula id felis rutrum placerat. Curabitur et lorem non urna tristique pharetra. Nullam luctus tristique dui.
<div class="quote">Etiam egestas scelerisque purus. Ipsum diam, hendrerit id, accumsan sit amet, fermentum vel, dui. Morbi blandit commodo tellus. Aenean tincidunt pharetra leo. <li style="margin-right: 0px;"><a href="http://makedesignnotwar.com/fullsize.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://makedesignnotwar.com/themes/pixelcraft/html/assets/img/pic_list/sample07.jpg"/></a></li>

</ul>
</li>


<li class="karmic_flow_slides" id="slide3">
<ul style="width: 960px">
	        			
<li><a href="http://makedesignnotwar.com/fullsize.jpg" rel="gallery[Portfolio]"><img src="http://makedesignnotwar.com/themes/pixelcraft/html/assets/img/pic_list/sample15.jpg"/></a></li>

<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>56</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2009-10-16 23:24:01</wp:post_date>
<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-10-17 06:24:01</wp:post_date_gmt>
<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

<wp:post_name>portfolio</wp:post_name>
<wp:status>publish</wp:status>

<wp:menu_order>4</wp:menu_order>

<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

<wp:meta_value>1</wp:meta_value>
</wp:postmeta>
<wp:postmeta>
<wp:meta_key>_wp_page_template</wp:meta_key>
<wp:meta_value>gallery.php</wp:meta_value>
</wp:postmeta>
<wp:postmeta>
<wp:meta_key>intro</wp:meta_key>
<wp:meta_value>Image Gallery</wp:meta_value>
</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
<item>
<title>About</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/about/</link>
<pubDate>Sat, 17 Oct 2009 06:27:22 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=25</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/instructions.jpg"><img src="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/Untitled-2.jpg" alt="instructions" title="instructions" width="196" height="196" class="alignleft size-full wp-image-148 avatar" /></a>

This is an example of a WordPress page, you can create and edit as many of these pages as you'd like in a matter of minutes. It's easy and fun to create content, and if you ever want to change it, you have full control over making edits and changes. Pages are considered to be more or less "fixed" pieces of content within this theme, where as Blog Posts are something that I anticipate you'll be making updates to on a frequent basis. Whether you want to release content as a Blog Post or a Page, it's incredibly easy to do. Try it out for yourself, I'll be happy to help you out if you run into problems!

You'll also notice that you can have "sub-pages" that show up underneath a "parent" page. It's easy to create these sub-pages, and the theme automatically lists them in the dropdown menu for you. It's really that easy! Creating and controlling your site's navigation is simple, including all of the links in the footer as well.
<ul>
	<li>Full page control, including custom headlines and sub-headlines for each page.</li>
	<li>Pre-styled content for all content types, including images, bold, italic, bullets, etc.</li>
	<li>Sidebar are easy to customize through Wordpress Widgets.</li>
	<li>Contact forms, search forms, and all major Wordpress content comes standard.</li>
</ul>

<h3>The Custom Admin Panel</h3>
I've taken the time to create a custom admin panel that allows you to change pretty much every major part of this theme that you can imagine. Included in the admin panel is full control over: the site logo, the homepage content, navigation &amp; footer pages, copyright information, the homepage callout block, and so much more!

What's best about this admin panel is that you have full control. Want to change the logo? Easy, you don't have to mess with any code or template files. Just insert the URL to your logo image and you're good to go. It really couldn't be easier.

<h3>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h3>
I've painstakingly gone through all text that could possibly show up in this theme to make sure it's as legible as possible. This template has been designed to be clean, modern, and easy for any business, individual, or creative to pick up and use right out of the box without any extra styling.

Lots of people will still have to make changes. That's fine too - I've broken out the stylesheets in this theme so that any coder or designer can quickly make either small or large changes to the template without any extra hassle. You'll need to know a little bit about coding to make any major changes, but the theme is organized and ready for you to start tinkering. 

I sincerely hope that you like the theme. I've worked hard to get it just right, and I'm always releasing updates for my products to make them better and better (which means I won't be abandoning the theme any time soon in case you need support or have a question). If you have any ideas, questions or concerns, just send me an email! 

<h3>What Clients are Saying</h3>
<blockquote><p>“I was recently told by a billionaire, &#8216;Building a business is amazingly simple, easy and fun, as long as you are working with the right people.&#8217; Brandon is the right people. He brings the enthusiasm and commitment of a true entrepreneur to each project. I can hear his smile over the phone. On the last major project with SAP, when the time got short and we had to push, he stayed up later than everyone else. He has a true passion for learning, the right attitude, focus and &#8220;mad&#8221; people skills. I know some day, we may all be asking him for a job.”<br />
- Shane Pearlman of <a href="http://www.shaneandpeter.com">Shane &amp; Peter</a>.</p></blockquote>
<blockquote><p>“Brandon has taught me how refreshing it can be to work with someone who is truely motivated, and highly skilled. He is one of those rare people who has a very sharp eye for design, but a strong capacity for code integration. He is invested in our best interests and knows how to work efficiently, tirelessly, and free from ego. Working with Brandon is a pleasure. I look forward to working wih him for years to come.”<br />

- Peter Chester of <a href="http://www.shaneandpeter.com">Shane &amp; Peter</a>.</p></blockquote>


Thanks for reading this overview page!]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>HTML Test Page</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/about/html-test-page/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 18 Oct 2009 23:26:43 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=124</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- Sample Content to Plugin to Template -->
<p>Comprehensive styling included! The purpose of this HTML page is to help showcase what the default settings are with CSS and to make sure that all possible HTML Elements are included in this HTML so as to not miss any possible Elements when designing a site. Don't like something you see here? You can change it easily from the well-organized CSS document.</p>

<hr />

<h1>Heading 1</h1>
<h2>Heading 2</h2>
<h3>Heading 3</h3>
<h4>Heading 4</h4>
<h5>Heading 5</h5>
<h6>Heading 6</h6>

<a href="#wrapper">[top]</a>
<hr />


<h1 id="paragraph">Paragraph</h1>
<a href="#"><img src="http://makedesignnotwar.com/themes/pixelcraft/html/assets/img/entrys/sample_avatar01.jpg" alt="example-08" width="150" height="150" class="alignright size-thumbnail wp-image-1026 avatar" /></a>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, <a href="#" title="test link">test link</a> adipiscing elit. Nullam dignissim convallis est. Quisque aliquam. Donec faucibus. Nunc iaculis suscipit dui. Nam sit amet sem. Aliquam libero nisi, imperdiet at, tincidunt nec, gravida vehicula, nisl. Praesent mattis, massa quis luctus fermentum, turpis mi volutpat justo, eu volutpat enim diam eget metus. Maecenas ornare tortor. Donec sed tellus eget sapien fringilla nonummy. Mauris a ante. Suspendisse quam sem, consequat at, commodo vitae, feugiat in, nunc. Morbi imperdiet augue quis tellus.</p>

<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, <em>emphasis</em> consectetuer adipiscing elit. Nullam dignissim convallis est. Quisque aliquam. Donec faucibus. Nunc iaculis suscipit dui. Nam sit amet sem. Aliquam libero nisi, imperdiet at, tincidunt nec, gravida vehicula, nisl. Praesent mattis, massa quis luctus fermentum, turpis mi volutpat justo, eu volutpat enim diam eget metus. Maecenas ornare tortor. Donec sed tellus eget sapien fringilla nonummy. Mauris a ante. Suspendisse quam sem, consequat at, commodo vitae, feugiat in, nunc. Morbi imperdiet augue quis tellus.</p>

<a href="#wrapper">[top]</a>
<hr />

<h1 id="list_types">List Types</h1>

<h3>Definition List</h3>
<dl>
	<dt>Definition List Title</dt>
	<dd>This is a definition list division.</dd>
</dl>

<h3>Ordered List</h3>
<ol>
	<li>List Item 1</li>
	<li>List Item 2</li>
	<li>List Item 3</li>
</ol>

<h3>Unordered List</h3>
<ul>
	<li>List Item 1</li>
	<li>List Item 2</li>
	<li>List Item 3</li>
</ul>

<a href="#wrapper">[top]</a>
<hr />

<h1 id="form_elements">Fieldsets, Legends, and Form Elements</h1>

<fieldset>
	<legend>Legend</legend>

	<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Nullam dignissim convallis est. Quisque aliquam. Donec faucibus. Nunc iaculis suscipit dui. Nam sit amet sem. Aliquam libero nisi, imperdiet at, tincidunt nec, gravida vehicula, nisl. Praesent mattis, massa quis luctus fermentum, turpis mi volutpat justo, eu volutpat enim diam eget metus.</p>

	<form>
		<h2>Form Element</h2>

		<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Nullam dignissim convallis est. Quisque aliquam. Donec faucibus. Nunc iaculis suscipit dui.</p>

		<p><label for="text_field">Text Field:</label><br />
		</p>

		<p><label for="text_area">Text Area:</label><br />
		<textarea></textarea></p>

		<p><label for="select_element">Select Element:</label><br />
			
			
				Option 1
				Option 2
				Option 3
			
			
				Option 1
				Option 2
				Option 3
			
		</p>

		<p><label for="radio_buttons">Radio Buttons:</label><br />
			 Radio 1<br />
				 Radio 2<br />
				 Radio 3<br />
		</p>

		<p><label for="checkboxes">Checkboxes:</label><br />
			 Radio 1<br />
				 Radio 2<br />
				 Radio 3<br />
		</p>

		<p><label for="password">Password:</label><br />
			
		</p>

		<p><label for="file">File Input:</label><br />
			
		</p>


		<p> 
		</p>



	</form>

</fieldset>

<a href="#wrapper">[top]</a>
<hr />

<h1 id="tables">Tables</h1>

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
	<tr>
		<th>Table Header 1</th><th>Table Header 2</th><th>Table Header 3</th>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>Division 1</td><td>Division 2</td><td>Division 3</td>
	</tr>
	<tr class="even">
		<td>Division 1</td><td>Division 2</td><td>Division 3</td>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>Division 1</td><td>Division 2</td><td>Division 3</td>
	</tr>

</table>

<a href="#wrapper">[top]</a>
<hr />

<h1 id="misc">Misc Stuff - abbr, acronym, pre, code, sub, sup, etc.</h1>

<p>Lorem <sup>superscript</sup> dolor <sub>subscript</sub> amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Nullam dignissim convallis est. Quisque aliquam. <cite>cite</cite>. Nunc iaculis suscipit dui. Nam sit amet sem. Aliquam libero nisi, imperdiet at, tincidunt nec, gravida vehicula, nisl. Praesent mattis, massa quis luctus fermentum, turpis mi volutpat justo, eu volutpat enim diam eget metus. Maecenas ornare tortor. Donec sed tellus eget sapien fringilla nonummy. <acronym title="National Basketball Association">NBA</acronym> Mauris a ante. Suspendisse quam sem, consequat at, commodo vitae, feugiat in, nunc. Morbi imperdiet augue quis tellus.  <abbr title="Avenue">AVE</abbr></p>

<pre><p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. <abbr title="Avenue">AVE</abbr></p></pre>

<blockquote>
	"This stylesheet is going to help so freaking much." <br />-Blockquote
</blockquote>

<item>
<title>Overview</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/about/overview/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 18 Oct 2009 23:27:13 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=126</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[
<h2 style="margin-top: 0px">Welcome to a PixelCraft Page Template</h2>

This is an example of a WordPress page, you can create and edit as many of these pages as you'd like in a matter of minutes. It's easy and fun to create content, and if you ever want to change it, you have full control over making edits and changes. Pages are considered to be more or less "fixed" pieces of content within this theme, where as Blog Posts are something that I anticipate you'll be making updates to on a frequent basis. Whether you want to release content as a Blog Post or a Page, it's incredibly easy to do. Try it out for yourself, I'll be happy to help you out if you run into problems!

<img src="http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/feature2.jpg" style="padding: 30px 0;" />

You'll also notice that you can have "sub-pages" that show up underneath a "parent" page. It's easy to create these sub-pages, and the theme automatically lists them in the dropdown menu for you. It's really that easy!
<ul>
	<li>Full page control, including custom headlines and sub-headlines for each page.</li>
	<li>Pre-styled content for all content types, including images, bold, italic, bullets, etc.</li>
	<li>Sidebar are easy to customize through Wordpress Widgets.</li>
	<li>Contact forms, search forms, and all major Wordpress content comes standard.</li>
</ul>

<h3>The Custom Admin Panel</h3>
I've taken the time to create a custom admin panel that allows you to change pretty much every major part of this theme that you can imagine. Included in the admin panel is full control over: the site logo, the homepage content, navigation &amp; footer pages, copyright information, the homepage callout block, and so much more!

What's best about this admin panel is that you have full control. Want to change the logo? Easy, you don't have to mess with any code or template files. Just insert the URL to your logo image and you're good to go. It really couldn't be easier.

<h3>Whoa! Ultra Readable Text</h3>
I've painstakingly gone through all text that could possibly show up in this theme to make sure it's as legible as possible. This template has been designed to be clean, modern, and easy for any business, individual, or creative to pick up and use right out of the box without any extra styling.

Lots of people will still have to make changes. That's fine too - I've broken out the stylesheets in this theme so that any coder or designer can quickly make either small or large changes to the template without any extra hassle. You'll need to know a little bit about coding to make any major changes, but the theme is organized and ready for you to start tinkering. 

I sincerely hope that you like the theme. I've worked hard to get it just right, and I'm always releasing updates for my products to make them better and better (which means I won't be abandoning the theme any time soon in case you need support or have a question). If you have any ideas, questions or concerns, just send me an email! 

<h2>What Clients are Saying</h2>
<blockquote><p>“I was recently told by a billionaire, &#8216;Building a business is amazingly simple, easy and fun, as long as you are working with the right people.&#8217; Brandon is the right people. He brings the enthusiasm and commitment of a true entrepreneur to each project. I can hear his smile over the phone. On the last major project with SAP, when the time got short and we had to push, he stayed up later than everyone else. He has a true passion for learning, the right attitude, focus and &#8220;mad&#8221; people skills. I know some day, we may all be asking him for a job.”<br />
- Shane Pearlman of <a href="http://www.shaneandpeter.com">Shane &amp; Peter</a>.</p></blockquote>
<blockquote><p>“Brandon has taught me how refreshing it can be to work with someone who is truely motivated, and highly skilled. He is one of those rare people who has a very sharp eye for design, but a strong capacity for code integration. He is invested in our best interests and knows how to work efficiently, tirelessly, and free from ego. Working with Brandon is a pleasure. I look forward to working wih him for years to come.”<br />

- Peter Chester of <a href="http://www.shaneandpeter.com">Shane &amp; Peter</a>.</p></blockquote>


Thanks for reading this overview page!]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Client List</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/about/client-list/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 18 Oct 2009 23:28:23 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=129</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2 style="margin-top: 0px">Client List</h2>

Over the past few years I've done a huge amount of work for a variety of businesses, from small indy clothing labels to Fortune 500 companies.  I thrive on constantly having new projects, new challenges, and new teams to work with.  Some of the teams that I've worked with recently are listed below, as well as a small sampling of the more notable clients that I've worked with.

*Note: My client and studio list change all the time.  A good portion of my work is protected under NDAs (non-disclosure agreements), which means that I'm often restricted to witholding information about both who I work for as well as what projects that I am working on.
<h2>Studios:</h2>
<a href="http://www.rukkus.tv">Rukkus</a>
<a href="http://www.shaneandpeter.com">Shane &amp; Peter</a>
<a href="http://www.jetpack.com">Jetpack</a>
<h2>Projects include work for:</h2>
<a href="http://www.acrylick.net">Acrylick Clothing</a>
<a href="http://www.adrevenue08">Ad Revenue 2008</a>
<a href="http://www.ask.com">Ask.com</a>
<a href="http://www.blip.tv">Blip.tv</a>
<a href="http://www.defjam.com">Def Jam Mobile</a>
<a href="http://www.directv.com">DirecTV</a>
<a href="http://www.dictionary.com">Dictionary.com</a>
<a href="http://www.ieee.org">IEEE</a>
<a href="http://www.theurbandaily.com/">Interactive One</a>
<a href="http://www.jacked.com">Jacked.com</a>
<a href="http://techtv.mit.edu/">MIT</a>
<a href="http://www.montereymusicsummit.com/2008/">Monterey Music Summit</a>
<a href="http://www.pubmatic.com/">Pubmatic</a>
<a href="http://www.sap.com">SAP</a>
<a href="http://www.shakeys.com/">Shakey's Pizza</a>
<a href="http://www.smartdesignusa.com/">Smart Design</a>
<a href="http://www.sproutwire.com">Sproutwire.com</a>
<a href="http://www.travelmuse.com/">Travel Muse</a>
<a href="http://www.westinghousedigital.com/">Westinghouse</a>

and lots more...
<h2>**Disclaimer:</h2>
This client list above represents a sampling of projects that I've participated in, but does not always mean that I was the sole entity hired for each project. In the case of many of these projects, the client company has hired another studio directly, not me.  In these cases I share the credit of working on each project with the rest of the project team. If you've got a question any specific projects I've worked on though, contact me and I'll be glad to share with you what I can. Rest assured, I've only listed projects where I have contributed a significant portion of the final product (my padded resume is much, much longer :P).]]></content:encoded>

<item>
<title>Full Width Template</title>
<link>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/about/full-width-template/</link>
<pubDate>Sun, 18 Oct 2009 23:28:37 +0000</pubDate>
<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/?page_id=131</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"><img class="size-full wp-image-234 aligncenter" src="http://concept.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/09/fullwidth2.jpg" alt="fullwidth" width="861" height="250" /></p>

This is an example of a full width WordPress page, you can create and edit as many of these pages as you’d like in a matter of minutes. It’s easy and fun to create content, and if you ever want to change it, you have full control over making edits and changes. Pages are considered to be more or less “fixed” pieces of content within this theme, where as Blog Posts are something that I anticipate you’ll be making updates to on a frequent basis. Whether you want to release content as a Blog Post or a Page, it’s incredibly easy to do. Try it out for yourself, I’ll be happy to help you out if you run into problems!

You’ll also notice that you can have “sub-pages” that show up underneath a “parent” page. It’s easy to create these sub-pages, and the theme automatically lists them in the dropdown menu for you. It’s really that easy!
<ul>
	<li>Full page control, including custom headlines and sub-headlines for each page.</li>
	<li>Pre-styled content for all content types, including images, bold, italic, bullets, etc.</li>
	<li>Sidebar are easy to customize through Wordpress Widgets.</li>
	<li>Contact forms, search forms, and all major Wordpress content comes standard.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

<guid isPermaLink="false">http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/longimage2.jpg</guid>
<description></description>
<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
<wp:post_id>145</wp:post_id>
<wp:post_date>2009-10-21 12:58:49</wp:post_date>

<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>

<wp:attachment_url>http://pixelcraft.makedesignnotwar.com/themes/wp/mu/wpmu/files/2009/10/longimage2.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
<wp:postmeta>

<wp:postmeta>
<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
